definition: to raise (animals)/to bring up (children)/to keep (pets)/to support/to give birth

sentences.english: They placed the orphans with foster-parents.
sentences.chinese: 他们为这些孤儿找到了养父养母。

sentences.english: Then Naomi took the child, laid him in her lap and cared for him.
sentences.chinese: 拿俄米就把孩子抱在怀中，作他的养母。

sentences.english: Both children seem very loyal to their adoptive mother.
sentences.chinese: 两个孩子似乎都对他们的养母忠心耿耿。

sentences.english: Yellow to porch immediately arrange color her mother to do the surgery.
sentences.chinese: 黄以轩立即安排彩娣的养母做了手术。

sentences.english: Shimin kneels on the ground and asks for his foster mother's forgiveness.
sentences.chinese: 世民知事情已被揭破，忙跪地恳求养母原谅。

sentences.english: Xiao dream allow mother change a work in the city.
sentences.chinese: 晓梦容许养母换一个城市打工。

sentences.english: The farmer raises cows and corn.
sentences.chinese: 那个农民养母牛，种玉米。

sentences.english: Ja-kyung was being tortured by her foster family because she fell in love with her uncle.
sentences.chinese: 她爱上了养母的弟弟，受到家里的百般折磨。

sentences.english: Tom was a heel for refusing support his foster mother.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆是个孽子，因为他拒绝扶养他的养母。

definition: to take in and care for (an elderly person, a dog etc)/to adopt (a child)/adoption
mutually dependent for life (idiom); to rely upon one another for survival/interdependent
